content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-197-06-B
|Item_parent=Spondyloarthritis
|Item_parent_short=Spondyloarthritis
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the extra-articular signs
|Description=Knowing how to recognise clinical manifestations
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=6}}
'''. Acute anterior uveitis ([[152. Red and/or painful eye]])''''

'''. Inflammatory enterocolopathy:'''' Crohn's disease or haemorrhagic rectocolitis, '''([[2. Diarrhoea]])'''''

'''. Psoriasis:''' Involvement of the scalp, inverted psoriasis and nail psoriasis are particularly associated with psoriatic arthritis, ('''81. Nail abnormality) ([[85. Erythema]])''''

'''. Very rare cardiac disorders:''' aortic or mitral valve disease, conduction disorders. '''([[18. Discovery of abnormalities on cardiac auscultation]])'''''

question.question: What is particularly associated with psoriatic arthritis?
question.option_a: Involvement of the hands and feet
question.option_b: Involvement of the scalp, inverted psoriasis and nail psoriasis
question.option_d: Acute anterior uveitis with red and/or painful eye
